item.title: How can I use CoinSimple with Magento?
item.description:
The CoinSimple Magento plugin allows e-commerce stores to accept bitcoin through CoinSimple.

Requirements

A Business ID and API key from CoinSimple.com. To find your information, go to your CoinSimple.com dashboard, select your business, and go to “Settings”. You will find your Business ID and API key under “Busines Information” and “API Credentials”.

Installation

There are two ways to install this plugin. (1) Through the “Magento Connect Manager” or (2) by uploading a file directly to your Magento server.

Option 1: Install using the “Magento Connect Manager”

  1. Download the specially formatted .tgz file of the plugin to a location of your choice.

  2. Log in to your Magento site as administrator and click on “Settings” and then “Magento Connect” and “Magento Connect Manager”.

  3. Login again, using the administrator user name and password.

  4. If not already selected, select the “Extensions” tab and go to the “Direct package upload” section of the page

  5. Choose the file that you downloaded in the first step, and click “Upload”. Magento Connect will import the file and show you the following screen.

Option 2: Install by uploading a file to your Magento server.

  1. Download the zip file of the plugin. Extract the zip file.
  2. Copy the contents of the zip file under in the root of your Magento installation, usually htdocs

At this point the plugin is installed and activated but it still needs to be enabled and configured.

Configuration

  1. Log in to your Magento site as administrator and click on “Settings” and then “Configuration”.
  1. In the screen that appears click on “Payment Methods” on the left.
  1. Select “Yes” in the “Enabled” dropdown menu and enter your CoinSimple.com business ID and CoinSimple API key in the appropriate fields. Also, enter the URL of the page that your customers will be directed to after they make their payment.
  1. Click “Save Config”.

Use

  • When a buyer selects “Bitcoin” as their payment method, an invoice is generated at CoinSimple.
  • After the buyer pays, CoinSimple directs the buyer to the page that you selected in your Settings above.

Support

CoinSimple Support

  • If you are having a problem with this plugin, please use this Github issues page to report your problem.

Magento Support

  • Homepage
  • Documentation
  • Community Edition Support Forums

Troubleshooting

  • This plugin requires PHP 5.4 or higher to function correctly. Contact your webhosting provider or server administrator if you are unsure which version is installed on your web server.
  • Ensure a valid SSL certificate is installed on your server. Also ensure your root CA cert is updated. If your CA cert is not current, you will see curl SSL verification errors.
  • Verify that your web server is not blocking POSTs from servers it may not recognize. Double check this on your firewall as well, if one is being used.
  • Check the system error log file (usually the web server error log) for any errors during CoinSimple payment attempts. If you contact CoinSimple support, they will ask to see the log file to help diagnose the problem.
  • If all else fails, send an email describing your issue in detail to . In your support request, please provide:
    • Magento version
    • PHP version
    • Other plugins installed
    • Configuration settings for the CoinSimple plugin
    • Screenshot of error messages, if any

item.title: How can I accept bitcoin directly to a bitcoin address using CoinSimple?
item.description:
You can use CoinSimple to accept bitcoins directly to any bitcoin address. This guide shows you how to find your bitcoin address in several wallets.

Example Wallets

  • Bitcoin Core
  • MultiBit
  • Hive
  • Green Address
  • Blockchain.info

Bitcoin Core

  1. Start Bitcoin Core and click on the “File” menu and the on “Receiving Addresses”.
  2. Select the address that you would like to use and click on the “Copy” button on the lower left.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Bitcoin Core wallet.

Back To Top

MultiBit

  1. Start MultiBit and click on the “Trade” menu and the on “Request Bitcoin”.
  2. On the right panel, you will see a Bitcoin address. Press on the button that is right next to the address to copy it to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your MultiBit wallet.

Back To Top

Hive

  1. Start Hive and hover your mouse over the Bitcoin address of your choice.
  2. Click on the address and it will be copied to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Hive wallet.

Back To Top

Green Address

  1. Start Green Address and click on “Receive Money” link on the left.
  2. Click on “Show URI and address”.
  3. Select the bitcoin address that starts with either 1 or 3 and copy it.
  4. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Green Address wallet.

Back To Top

Blockchain.info

  1. Login to Blockchain.info.
  2. On the lower left of the screen, you will see a box that says “This Is Your Bitcoin Address”. Copy the address to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Blockchain.info wallet.

Back To Top

item.title: How can I connect my BitPay account with CoinSimple?
item.description:
In order to use CoinSimple to integrate with the BitPay bitcoin payment processor, you need to pair your BitPay account with CoinSimple. This guide explains how to do that.

Please follow these steps:

  1. Login to your BitPay account and click on the menu link in the upper left part of your screen.

  2. Click on ‘Settings’.

BitPay Menu: Settings

Login to your BitPay account and click on the menu link in the upper left part of your screen. Click on ‘Settings’.

  1. Scroll down the menu until you find the ‘Developer Resources’ subsection of the Settings menu. Click on ‘API Tokens’.
BitPay Menu: API Tokens

Scroll down the menu until you find the ‘Developer Resources’ subsection of the Settings menu. Click on ‘API Tokens’.

  1. Click on ‘Add New Token’.
BitPay Menu: Add New Token

Click on ‘Add New Token’.

  1. In the ‘Token Label’ field enter a name for your token, for example ‘CoinSimple’ and press ‘Add Token’.
BitPay Form: Add Token

In the ‘Token Label’ field enter a name for your token, for example ‘CoinSimple’ and press ‘Add Token’.

  1. Copy the ‘Pairing Code’ shown and copy it.
BitPay Pairing Code

Copy the ‘Pairing Code’ shown and copy it.

  1. Go to the CoinSimple website, navigate to “Settings”, “Wallets and Processors”, and click on “BitPay”. In the form that appears, paste the copied pairing code.
  2. Click “Submit”
  3. You will need to verify the addition of your BitPay account. So, check your email for a message from CoinSimple and click on the relevant link.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to the BitPay account.

item.title: How can I connect my BitPay account with CoinSimple using BitPay's legacy API keys?
item.description:
In order to use CoinSimple to integrate with the BitPay bitcoin payment processor, you need to copy your BitPay API key on your BitPay dashboard and enter it in CoinSimple. This guide explains how to do that.

Please follow these steps:

  1. Go to bitpay.com and sign in.
  2. Go to bitpay.com/api-keys.
  3. Click on the “Add New API Key” button.
  4. (Optional) Click on the “Edit” button and in the memo field add the description “CoinSimple”.
  5. Copy the “API Key ID”, that is a series of characters and numbers like gO0HWTAT9v3UJVP89kQNO2ZSpmmZcUzukr6EeuskER1.
  6. Return to the BitPay page on the CoinSimple website. Paste the copied the key in the “API Key ID” field. Press “Submit”.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin through BitPay, no developer was necessary.

item.title: CoinSimple and MeXBT working to integrate their platforms
item.description:
Miami, January 17, 2015: Hong Kong-based e-commerce platform CoinSimple and meXBT, one of Latin America’s leading Bitcoin exchanges will integrate to give their customers the best of both worlds. On behalf of the two Seedcoin-backed startups, CoinSimple Founder and CEO Nikos Bentenitis and meXBT Founder and CEO Gabriel Miron announced the news today during The North American Bitcoin Conference.

Under the agreement, CoinSimple clients will be able to use meXBT’s bitcoin prices and exchange services, and meXBT clients will be able to create fully functioning CoinSimple accounts in a few clicks. Furthermore, the MeXBT-CoinSimple integration will allow customers of meXBT to use the CoinSimple web app to issue invoices for services; the CoinSimple Wordpress eCommerce, WooCommerce and Magento plugins to sell products through their online stores; and the “Pay in Bitcoin” buttons on any web page to accept donations or even sell individual products.

“We are looking forward to working with CoinSimple to expand our merchant offerings in Latin America, and to continue driving bitcoin adoption in the region”, said Miron.

“We are excited to partner with meXBT and expand our services and white-label merchant processing to Mexico and Latin America,” said Bentenitis.

About meXBT.com: Providing digital currencies for serious traders and simple enough for beginners, meXBT’s goal is to provide the best and most secure service to traders of digital currencies. meXBT is combining state-of-the-art technology with a rock solid legal and fiscal structure on a single platform called meXBT.com, the ‘Crypto Exchange of the Americas,’ and the place to be when exchanging cryptos. www.mexbt.com.

About CoinSimple: CoinSimple provides “Full Bitcoin e-Commerce, Direct to Wallet”. “Full Bitcoin e-Commerce” because it provides sophisticated merchant processing that includes multiple currencies, customer analytics, unique bitcoin addresses per transaction, accounting, invoices, email notifications and plugins for e-Commerce platforms (Wordpress, WooCommerce, Magento etc.) “Direct to wallet” because it allows full control of funds, privacy, deterministic wallets, choice of price source, ability to convert bitcoin at the exchange of choice. For more information about CoinSimple, please visit CoinSimple.com.

About Seedcoin: Seedcoin is the world’s first seed-stage Bitcoin startup virtual incubator. Seedcoin’s objective is to invest in the creative entrepreneurs of the cryptocurrency and blockchain economy and help them develop the future services, products and applications re-shaping the way we interact with money on a daily basis. Visit www.seedco.in for more information.

item.title: How can I use CoinSimple to issue invoices and send them via email?
item.description:
This guide explains how to issue your first CoinSimple invoice, in 2 steps. The process is quite simple but the steps are described here in great detail.

If you haven’t already done so, set up an account with CoinSimple. Detailed instructions on how to do that, can be found here.

1. Create an invoice

All you have to do is click on “Invoices” and then on “New Invoice”. At that point you need to enter or choose:

  • You client’s name
  • Your client’s email
  • The currency that you want to price your invoice in (all national currencies are supported)
  • The wallet or payment processor that you want to receive your funds to
  • The source of bitcoin price (Bitcoin Average, CoinDesk, Blockchain.info, Bitstamp, BitPay, Coinbase, GoCoin) or a set price
  • The name of your invoice items, their numbers and their unit price

You can also, optionally, choose a discount or to make your invoice recurring, on the same day of every month, or every a certain number of days. Recurring invoices will be sent perpetually, or for a certain number of times.

2. Save the invoice and select delivery options

At this point, you can send your invoice via email, review it, edit it, or delete it.

item.title: How can I set up an account with CoinSimple?
item.description:
This guide will explain the process for signing up with CoinSimple in 3 steps. The process is quite simple but the steps are described in great detail.

1. Sign Up for a CoinSimple account

Go to the CoinSimple Sign Up page. Enter your name, your email and select a password. After you read the CoinSimple Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, and check that you agree with them.

2. Set up a business

The app will automatically lead you to a page to set up a new business. (In order to create an invoice, you need to first create a business, that is why, the app will not let you move to any other part of the site, before you set up a business.) In the form that appears, enter the name of your business and its description. Both the name and description of your business appear in the invoices that you send to your customers, so choose them appropriately. Also, enter the currency that you use most commonly for your invoices (you can change that later and even for every invoice that you issue). Finally, enter the source of the bitcoin price that you will most commonly use for your invoices (again, you can change the source later, and for every invoice, if you like.) After you select whether you want to receive emails when you create a new invoice and when you get paid, you are done.

3. Connect your wallet or payment processor

The app will now lead you to a page to connect your wallet or your existing bitcoin processor account. (In order to get paid for your invoices, you will need to have a wallet where the funds will be directed – CoinSimple does not offer a wallet service. That is why, the app will not let you move to any other part of the site, if you don’t set up wallet.) These support pages explain how you can connect your Electrum, Armory, Trezor, or any bitcoin address. At this point you can add additional wallets and bitcoin payment processors to your business to give yourself more flexibility.

item.title: How can I use CoinSimple with WooCommerce?
item.description:
The CoinSimple WooCommerce plugin is an extension of the WooCommerce plugin for Wordpress, and allows e-commerce stores, running on Wordpress and WooCommerce, to accept bitcoin through CoinSimple.

Requirements

  1. Installed WooCommerce plugin on your Wordpress site. (Installation instructions can be found at www.woothemes.com/woocommerce).
  2. A Business ID and API key from CoinSimple.com. To find your information, go to your CoinSimple.com dashboard, select your business, and go to “Settings”. You will find your Business ID and API key under “Busines Information” and “API Credentials”.

Installation

  1. Download a zip file of the plugin from this link.
  2. Log in to your WordPress site as administrator and click on “Plugins”->“Add New”->“Upload”->“Choose file” and select the zip file you downloaded. Click on “Install Now” followed by “Activate Plugin”.

At this point the plugin is installed and activated but it still needs to be enabled and configured.

Configuration

  1. Log into the WordPress dashboard and click “WooCommerce” and then “Settings”.
  1. In the screen that appears click on “Checkout” and then “CoinSimple”.
  1. Enter your CoinSimple.com business ID and API in the appropriate fields. Enter the URL of the page that your customers will be directed to after they make their payment.
  1. Click “Save changes”.

Use

  • When a buyer selects “Bitcoin” as their payment method, an invoice is generated at CoinSimple.
  • After the buyer pays, CoinSimple directs the buyer to the page that you selected in your Settings above.

Support

CoinSimple Support

  • If you are having a problem with this plugin, please use this Github issues page to report your problem.

WooCommerce Support

  • Homepage
  • Documentation
  • Support

Troubleshooting

  • This plugin requires PHP 5.4 or higher to function correctly. Contact your webhosting provider or server administrator if you are unsure which version is installed on your web server.
  • Ensure a valid SSL certificate is installed on your server. Also ensure your root CA cert is updated. If your CA cert is not current, you will see curl SSL verification errors.
  • Verify that your web server is not blocking POSTs from servers it may not recognize. Double check this on your firewall as well, if one is being used.
  • Check the system error log file (usually the web server error log) for any errors during CoinSimple payment attempts. If you contact CoinSimple support, they will ask to see the log file to help diagnose the problem.
  • If all else fails, send an email describing your issue in detail to . In your support request, please provide:
    • Wordpress version
    • WooCommerce version
    • PHP version
    • Other plugins installed
    • Configuration settings for the CoinSimple plugin
    • Screenshot of error messages, if any
